allowInitializePath((uint32,bytes32,uint.details: This indicates to the endpoint that the OApp has enabled msgs for this particular path to be received.This defaults to assuming if a peer has been set, its initialized. Can be overridden by the OApp if there is other logic to determine this.

params.origin: The origin information containing the source endpoint and sender address.

returns._0: Whether the path has been initialized.

params.crossChainController: address of the contract that manages cross chain infrastructure
params.lzEndpoint: address of the layer zero endpoint on the current chain where adapter is deployed
params.providerGasLimit: base gas limit used by the bridge adapter
params.trustedRemotes: array of objects with chain id and origin addresses which will be allowed to send messages to this adapter

params.destinationChainId: id of the destination chain in the bridge notation
params.executionGasLimit: amount of the gas limit in wei to use for delivering the message on destination network. Each adapter will manage this as needed.
params.message: to send to the specified chain
params.receiver: address of the receiver contract on destination chain

returns._0: the third-party bridge entrypoint, the third-party bridge message id

params.chainId: id of the chain from where to get the trusted remote

lzReceive((uint32,bytes32,uint64),bytes3.details: Entry point for receiving messages or packets from the endpoint.Entry point for receiving msg/packet from the LayerZero endpoint.

params._executor: The address of the executor for the received message.
params._extraData: Additional arbitrary data provided by the corresponding executor.
params._guid: The unique identifier for the received LayerZero message.
params._message: The payload of the received message.
params._origin: The origin information containing the source endpoint and sender address.  - srcEid: The source chain endpoint ID.  - sender: The sender address on the src chain.  - nonce: The nonce of the message.

nextNonce(uint32,bytes32).details: _srcEid The source endpoint ID._sender The sender address.The path nonce starts from 1. If 0 is returned it means that there is NO nonce ordered enforcement.Is required by the off-chain executor to determine the OApp expects msg execution is ordered.This is also enforced by the OApp.By default this is NOT enabled. ie. nextNonce is hardcoded to return 0.

BASE_GAS_LIMIT().notice: method to get the base gas limit used by the bridge adapter

CROSS_CHAIN_CONTROLLER().notice: method to get the address of the linked cross chain controller

LZ_ENDPOINT().notice: returns the layer zero endpoint address

adapterName().notice: method to get the name of the adapter contract

allowInitializePath((uint32,bytes32,uint.notice: Checks if the path initialization is allowed based on the provided origin.

constructor.notice: constructor for the Layer Zero adapter

forwardMessage(address,uint256,uint256,b.notice: method that will bridge the payload to the chain specified

getTrustedRemoteByChainId(uint256).notice: method to get the trusted remote address from a specified chain id

infraToNativeChainId(uint256).notice: method to get bridge native chain id from native bridge chain id

nativeToInfraChainId(uint256).notice: method to get infrastructure chain id from bridge native chain id

nextNonce(uint32,bytes32).notice: Retrieves the next nonce for a given source endpoint and sender address.

setupPayments().notice: method used to setup payment, ie grant approvals over tokens used to pay for tx fees
